description:
The "Abductors" Invaders from Altea come to Earth with only one purpose, to harvest humans. DEAVA the Aquaria Academy exists to train men and women to use Aquaria, but they cannot ever merge because of Guize stones, these block an "unholy union" between genders. The story follows Amata and Mikono in their enrollment into DEAVA, and fight their fight with Abductors.

(Source: FUNimation)

tags.name: Super Robot
tags.description: Prominently features large robots often piloted by hot-blooded protagonists.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Boys' Love
tags.description: Prominently features romance between two males, not inherently sexual.

name.native: シリウス・ド・アリシア

edges.role: Theme Song Composition (OP, ED & Insert Songs)

node.description:
Kanno's earliest experiences with music came from attending church with her parents. She studied keyboard from a young age on both the piano in her home and the organ at her kindergarten. In elementary school, she began participating in composition contests, but in high school, Kanno began to take more of an interest in literature than in music.

She attended Waseda University, where she majored in literature, but she transcribed music for various student groups at Waseda in her free time. While in university, Koei, a Japanese video game company, asked her to compose the soundtrack to Nobunaga's Ambition. The game turned out to be a hit, and Kanno's music career was launched.

Kanno has also composed music for artists such as [Maaya Sakamoto](https://anilist.co/staff/95090/), [Megumi Nakajima](https://anilist.co/staff/96105/) and [Kyouko Koizumi](https://anilist.co/staff/164646/). She is also a keyboardist, as well as the frontwoman for [Seatbelts](https://anilist.co/staff/193673/), who perform many of Kanno's compositions and soundtracks.

She has collaborated with directors [Shinichirou Watanabe](https://anilist.co/staff/97009/) and [Shouji Kawamori](https://anilist.co/staff/97501/) multiple times.

In addition to Japanese, she speaks a little English and some French.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamayama800) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山口宏_(脚本家%29)

He's Japanese screenwriter and novelist, and one of the founders of Studio [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO).

Shouji Kawamori is an anime creator, director and mechanical designer. Also a current advisor for [Satelight](https://anilist.co/studio/41/).

Famous for his work in the [Macross](https://anilist.co/anime/1088/) and Transformers franchises. He pioneered several innovative concepts in his works, such as transforming mecha (including the VF-1 Valkyrie in Macross and Optimus Prime in Transformers) and virtual idols (including Lynn Minmay and Sharon Apple in the Macross franchise).

Kawamori attended Keio University together with Macross screenwriter [Hiroshi Oonogi](https://anilist.co/staff/97701/) and character designer [Haruhiko Mikimoto](https://anilist.co/staff/96968/). There they became friends and founded a [Mobile Suit Gundam](https://anilist.co/anime/80/) fan club called "Gunsight One," a name the group would use years later during the development of the fictional world of the Macross series. Later on his career Kawamori created or co-created the concepts which served as basis for several anime series. His projects are usually noted to contain strong themes of love, war, spirituality or mysticism, and ecological concern.

Kawamori also helped to design various toys for the Takara toyline, Diaclone in the early '80s. Among them the first Optimus Prime toy design, Prowl, Bluestreak, Smokescreen, Ironhide, and Ratchet. Over 20 years later, he returned to Transformers by designing both the Hybrid Style Convoy and the Masterpiece version of Starscream for Takara.

Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.
Recipient of the Individual Award at The 16th Animation Kobe Awards in 2011.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B2%B8%E7%94%B0%E9%9A%86%E5%AE%8F)

Takahiro Kishida is an animator and renown character designer.

Kishida's designs are well received by animators and attract talent into shows easily. He is also praised for his shot composition skills and copies of his layouts are widely distributed in the industry as drawing reference. Nowadays he is mostly only credited for character design in the shows he participates in, but in reality he works as an animation director uncredited quite often. He rarely heavily corrects the key animator's cuts, strongly believing that the animators' distinctiveness should be noticeable.

Noted for his designs on shows like [Haikyuu](https://anilist.co/anime/20464/), [Serial Experiments Lain](https://anilist.co/anime/339/), [Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/), [Baccano](https://anilist.co/anime/2251/) and more.

Originating from Eagle Nest. Currently freelance.

Tanaka first drew attention for the wild and imaginative fight sequences in Precure [Max Heart](https://anilist.co/anime/1929/) and [Splash Star](https://anilist.co/anime/1534/). Following this he expanded his scope and took up work on productions all around the industry, showing that fights aren't everything he can do. His variety on running sequences, often showing an effiminate touch, as well as the particular attention to hair, down to all little strains and often involving a hairdo having a life of its own, are some of Tanaka's most outstanding feats.

__Non-anime credits:__
~!
- Chief Animator, Animation Character Design, Storyboard, Director, Animation Director, Key Animation for "BlazBlue: Calamity Trigger (OP)" (video game, 2008)
- Key Animation for "Disgaea D2: A Brighter Darkness (OP)" (video game, 2013)
- Key Animation for "livetune adding Fukase (from SEKAI NO OWARI) 「Take Your Way」" (music video, 2013)
- Key Animation for "Rurouni Kenshin: Meiji Kenkaku Romantan Saisen (OP)" (video game, 2011)
- Key Animation for "Valkyria Chronicles III" (video game, 2011)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/64664693)

Yamamoto's interest in working in the anime industry piqued in high school after realizing how noticeable the difference in episodes were depending on the episode director in charge. One of his favourites shows included [Seisenshi Dunbine](https://anilist.co/anime/929/).

In the late '80s, he joined [Sunrise](https://anilist.co/studio/14/) as a production assistant after finding out that it's how many of the studio's directors started off. There he met and studied under [Shuuji Iuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/115833/) on his shows [Madou King Granzort](https://anilist.co/anime/2818/) and [Mashin Eiyuuden Wataru](https://anilist.co/anime/4807/). Then after having gone freelance he got his first shot as a director as one of the three unit directors on Iuchi's [Ranma ½ film](https://anilist.co/anime/418/) in 1991.

In 2001, Yamamoto made his debut as a series director on [Shiawase Sou no Okojo-san](https://anilist.co/anime/2934/), soon after which he worked as the first director of the long-running [Keroro Gunsou](https://anilist.co/anime/516/). In 2006 he directed the well-received [NHK ni Youkoso!](https://anilist.co/anime/1210/)

More recent directorial works of his include [Yama no Susume](https://anilist.co/anime/14355/) and [Shounen Maid](https://anilist.co/anime/21321/).

**Height:** 150 cm

[Website](http://www.ogurayui.jp) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/ogurayui-0815) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/OY_A_Official) | [Twitter (Personal)](https://twitter.com/yui_ogura_815) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCjoIKN4CybsJyv0pWwAUJ5w) | [LINE](https://lineblog.me/ogurayui) | [Clare Voice](http://clare-voice.co.jp/talent) | [YuiKaori](http://www.yuikaori.info) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/27839.html) | [Wikipedia](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B0%8F%E5%80%89%E5%94%AF) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yui_ogura_official) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@yui_ogura_offcial)

Not to be confused with [Yui Ogura (小倉結衣)](https://anilist.co/staff/123771).

Yui Ogura is an idol, actress, singer and voice actress (seiyuu) affiliated with Clare Voice. She is one of four members in Team Dekaris along with Kaori Ishihara, Arisa Noto, and Maho Matsunaga. She was one half of J-Pop duo [YuiKaori](https://anilist.co/staff/195974/), along with [Kaori Ishihara](https://anilist.co/staff/105217/) before the group disbanded in 2017. She is a former member of the seiyuu group [StylipS](https://anilist.co/staff/111177/), which was formed in 2011 and composed of the same members of Team Dekaris. Ogura's debut single "Raise" was released on July 18, 2012. She graduated from the group in April 2013.

__Non-anime roles:__
- Amatsukaze - Kancolle (VG)
- Taigei/Ryuuhou - Kancolle (VG)
- Harbour Princess - Kancolle (VG)
- Isolated Island Demon - Kancolle (VG)

- Luna - Shadowverse (VG) 
- Monologue Asahina - Girlfriend (Kari) (VG)
- March 7th - Honkai: Star Rail (VG) 
- Minori Hanasato - Project Sekai: Colorful Stage! feat. Hatsune Miku (VG) 
- Natasha - Memento Mori (VG) 
- Nina - Liberation of Azure (VG)

- Passion Lip - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
- Primula - Shironeko Tennis (VG) (Japanese)
- Pupuru - Sei Madou Monogatari (VG) (Japanese)
- Rom / White Sister - Choujigen Game Neptune (VG)

**Height:** 163cm

Akino Kawamitsu, better known by her stage name AKINO, is an American-born Japanese pop singer, from Utah. Originally debuting in 2003 with her brothers Akashi and Aiki and her sister Kanasa in the band bless4, Akino made her solo debut in 2005 singing the opening themes of the TV anime Sousei no Aquarion. Her debut album "Lost in Time" was released in 2007 under her new stage name, AKINO from bless4. All of her songs are composed by Yoko Kanno.

**Height:** 163cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/jcykc661) | [Pixiv (NSFW)](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=4539873)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Sunma47) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三間雅文)

One of the industry's most prolific sound directors, having worked on more than 300 productions.

After having graduated college, Mima joined Magic Capsule, a sound production company ran by his relative [Susumu Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/120062/). In 1986, he debuted as a sound director on [MD Geist](https://anilist.co/anime/1285/MD-Geist/). He left Magic Capsule in 1996, and later joined Techno Sound. In 2004, he became the studio's representative director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usagi_rakuda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/立川譲)

After graduating from university in 2007, Tachikawa joined [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) where he debuted as an episode director on [Kiba](https://anilist.co/anime/845/)'s final episode. After this he went freelance.

Some years later in 2013, Tachikawa created, wrote and directed [Death Billiards](https://anilist.co/anime/14353/), a short film produced by Madhouse as part of Young Animator Training Project's; Anime Mirai, a project which funds young creators and animators. Two years later, Tachikawa got to turn the idea into a 12-episode TV series titled [Death Parade](https://anilist.co/anime/20931/).

He has since gone on to direct works such as [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/) and [Detective Conan: Zero the Enforcer](https://anilist.co/anime/100653/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/usagi_rakuda) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/立川譲)
